creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: frogs in an interior dressed in various types of garments; many frogs writing or reading; screens on R with two frogs outside on street wearing hats
text: Originally part of a handscroll, in the manner of the 12th- or 13th-century Frolicking Animals and Humans featuring winsome anthropomorphized animals, this fragment was later remounted as a hanging scroll. The ungainliness of the frogs pokes fun at the perceived refinement of calligraphy, poetry, and other courtly pastimes.
title: Frogs in Writing Contest
